ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] In response to the Plea for help
ygData.msgSnippet: or deemed what? PsyKo  wrote:Tried sending this to the e-mail addy, but it bounced. Im just  sending it here instead. Hey, I
ygData.messageBody:
or deemed what?
PsyKo <sibilant_ghost@...> wrote:Tried sending this to the e-mail addy, but it bounced.
Im just sending it here instead.


Hey, I understand the Senior Thesis problem, so here
is a website with a great article talking about how 48
Hours trashed EQ.

http://everquest.allakhazam.com/news/sdetail1142.html?story=1142

In my experience, anyone who would be so afflicted by
the outcome of a game is not a terribly stable person
in the first place. Everquest has actually helped me
save money for tuition, and has kept me out of trouble
as well. I sit at home and play EverQuest for a few
hours every night. With a starting cost of 9.95 for
the game, 12.95 a month for a pre-paid card (I hate
credit cards), I get the first month free, 19.99 a
month in internet services (which I would have anyway)

Lets figure roughly how much I spend in a 4 month
period 79.96 internet 9.95 for the game and 38.85
for the card. 128.74 total spending on the game in a
4 month period.

And, a little comparison. 7.50 movie ticket 5.00
small popcorn (highway robbery [the cost of movie
popcorn should be regulated =P ]) 12.50 x 5 nights a
week 62.50 a week. Or for the more conservative (such
as myself) 5.95 for a new paperback book (I go through
about 4 of these a week when im not playing online).
5.95 x 4 23.80 per week. The only way I could see
overcoming the savings seen here is to go to the
library. The one in my town kinda sux so I don't very
often.

On the other hand, It cuts you off from anything
social or deemed
